text.0: agni first loudly calling like a father kindled by man upon the seat of worship.
text.1: clothed in his glory deathless keen of insight must be adorned by all the strong the famous.
text.2: may agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs immortal keen of insight.
text.3: dark steeds or ruddy draw his car or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.
text.4: on wood supine they got the wellformed infant a germ in variousfashioned plants was agni.
text.5: and in the night not compassed round by darkness he dwells exceeding wise with rays of splendour.
text.6: with oil and sacred gifts i sprinkle agni who makes his home in front of all things living.
text.7: broad vast through vital power oer all expanded conspicuous strong with all the food that feeds him.
text.8: i pour to him who looks in all directions may he accept it with a friendly spirit.
text.9: agni with bridegrooms grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.
text.10: by choice victorious recognize thy portion with thee for envoy may we speak like manu.
text.11: obtaining wealth i call on perfect agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.
